resources.string: "Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."
Access your electronic services and seek help!

The assignment includes two parts:Part A: A simple prototype piece of mobile/web application software which provides a creative solution to a real-world problem, as agreed by the instructor. Part B: Supporting documentation in the form of a report (2,500 words). By the end of the semester each student must deliver an in-class oral presentation of his/her work, supported by appropriate electronic material (system prototype, PowerPoint slides, etc).

Design and develop mobile and Web applications from a given specification using appropriate programming languages and frameworks. Compile documentation that will indicate evidence of design and testing their application. Assess and contrast the challenges of developing mobile and Web applications compared to other platforms. The delivery of material will be through a combination of lectures and tutorial classes. The assessment for CIS5006 consists of a programming assignment (of the equivalent of 6000 words) worth 100%. The students will be asked to research, rationalize and develop a mobile/web application, based on detailed specifications.
On successful completion of the module, students should be able to:

Welcome to CIS5006 Mobile and Web technologies. This module aims to provide the student with the skills necessary to develop mobile and Web applications using appropriate programming languages and frameworks, along with the relevant design, testing, documentation and support. It also contrasts mobile and Web applications with traditional applications to identify specific requirements and demands of building application for the mobile and Web.
